item.description:
This is a good 9.8 mile looping hike to the summit of Soapstone Mountain's observation tower and back. Any of you who watched the weather with Hilton Caderly used to watch the radar loop spin around in north central Connecticut. This is where that radar was stationed.

We are hiking the Shenipsit Trail in the state's blue blaze system on the way up and then trying some other trails on the way down to make a loop. This will be a 9.83 mile in, up, loop, and back kind of a trip. This is a beautiful section with good views of Massachusetts from the tower at the top at 1075'.

The hike would start from the blue blazed Shenipsit trailhead on Hopkins Rd., a dirt road just off of Rte. 140 in Ellington across from Lake Bonair. The hike will be moderate to high moderate given some up/down on the trail and the length. Plan on being out for 5.5 to 7.5 hours depending how fast we go. We should be back by 4 PM at the latest (sunset is 4:24 PM). There are ways we could shorten the return hike by up to 1 mi. if a situation calls for it.

Meet and park on the shoulder of the Hopkins Rd. dirt road about .1 mile from the intersection with Rte. 140.

Plan on wearing hiking boots, bring 1 - 2 quarts of water, and some trail food/lunch for energy. We will break at the top for lunch. Day pack would be great to hold it all.

Total distance from Hopkins Rd. start - some landmarks we will intersect:
* 2.8 miles to trail intersect with Sykes Rd. (dirt)
* 3.3 miles to trail intersect with Parker Rd. (dirt)
* 4.5 miles to peak & observation tower

Total distance from observation tower at peak - some landmarks we will intersect:
* 1.3 miles to trail intersect with Webster Rd. (dirt)
* 1.73 miles to trail intersect with Sykes Rd. and blue blazed trail (dirt)
* 4.08 miles to rejoin with blue blazed trail
* 5.34 miles to return at Hopkins Rd. (dirt)
